intro: Watsonia schlechteri, commonly known as the Orange Watsonia, is a striking South African bulbous plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It features tall, upright stems with showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a robust underground bulb and linear, grass-like leaves that form a dense rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Watsonia schlechteri is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
